text: RT @SayftyCom: Q5. How can women in abusive relationships help other women? #SayftyChat @MeghnaPant https://t.co/T3w3tl0tK4
A4 Sometimes I find it difficult to believe that I‚Äôm still here. But I am. And I'm laughing again
column4: in love again. You will too. #sayftychat

text: A4 You'll smile again and be able to trust again. You may also love again
column4: or not. It doesn‚Äôt matter. The worse is behind you. #sayftychat

text: A4 Soon
column4: the scars will heal. The tears will dry. You'll no longer feel a weight on your shoulders. You'll feel light. And free! #sayftychat

text: A4 You will cry. A lot. You'll feel hopeless
column4: depressed
column6: my friend. It'll only get better from here. #sayftychat

text: RT @SayftyCom: Q4. How can women in abusive relationships go about reclaiming their lives and confidence? #SayftyChat @MeghnaPant https://t‚Ä¶
A3 Report him to the police. Go to a woman‚Äôs organisation/social worker. The Domestic Violence Act 2005 protects you. Be strong! #sayftychat
A3 Don't be afraid of being judged. Or of being alone. Don't be afraid of HIM. You‚Äôll tell yourself you can‚Äôt do it. You can. #sayftychat
A3 The biggest help is self help. Get out of the house immediately. Take your kids. Be out of reach to him. Gather evidence. #sayftychat
RT @SayftyCom: Q3. How can women in abusive relationships get help? #SayftyChat @MeghnaPant https://t.co/kRSDZXnr9s
A2 Seek professional help. Go to a therapist for emotional aid
column4: a social worker for practical aid and a lawyer for legal aid.  #sayftychat

text: A2 Speak to someone you trust: a family member
column4: friend
column5: neighbour. Be careful from whom you take advise. Some ppl may doubt you! #sayftychat

text: A2 First step: confront your abuser. If he's willing to change
column4: get him help! If he's not
column5: get out! Your patience can kill you! #sayftychat

text: RT @SayftyCom: Q2. What are some ways that women can speak out against this abuse? #SayftyChat @MeghnaPant https://t.co/I7EYGtq2fN
A1 A woman knows when she's being abused. It may take her a day/month/year to admit it
column4: but that awful fear will never go away. #sayftychat

text: A1 If a man is oversensitive
column4: petty
column8: he may be more susceptible to hit you.  #sayftychat

text: A1 The first step a woman must take is to accept that she is in an abusive relationship. She must understand what abuse means. #sayftychat
A1 Many women think that unless a man sends you to the hospital it's not an act of violence. Not true. Even a slap is violence.  #sayftychat
